intro: Eremiopsis, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and Angola. Eremiopsis species are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. They are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep root systems and water-storing tissues. The genus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing food for local wildlife.
